text: Draft at mother Kellys, London. It pours a clean pale yellow color Witt no head. Aroma is is sweet and juicy with plenty notes of pears and baked apples and light esters. Taste is also sweet with more baked pears, apples and esters. Light to medium bodied with no carbonation. Overall, ok

Draught at Augustus John, Liverpool. Hazy pale yellow colour, no head and earthy pear aroma. Taste is sweetish pear, fruity, melon and citric notes. Syrupy mouthfeel, light to medium bodied, low carbonation, mellow dry finish. Quite OK.

Cask handpump at the Cock Tavern - Hackney. Noted at 5%. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy, white head. Interesting aroma, a little dank, with some rotting pear, herbs, lemon peel. Light to medium sweet flavour with lots of overripe fruit, mellow pear, some green herbs, maybe rosemary, slight citric tang, salty sweat, doughy biscuits. Medium bodied with spritzy carbonation. Finishes with more herbal notes, ripe lemon, dough, impressions of pear, apple skin, pie crust. Quite interesting stuff on the whole, although I wouldnt say the drinkability is very high.

Bag in box @ Willow Walk (JDW), Victoria SW1. Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow color with no head. Has a fruity slightly spicy smooth pear aroma. Fruity spicy slightly sweetish pear flavor. Has a fruity spicy sweetish pear finish.
Poly pin at standing order... Light golden yellow.. Thin white lacing... Soft fruits nose.. Dry pear.. Juicy fruits.. Light peppery fruits
Box @ Boot Inn, Burnley. Pale dishwater yellow. Crisp with a good dry apple flavour and nose to match.
Bag-in-a-box at the Old Manor (JDW), Bracknell. Very pale with a floral aroma; fuzzy pear taste; and some citrus to finish. Very drinkable.

Pale yellow perry, still. Aroma is faint pear. Taste is pear juice and some hints of wood. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bag in box, Society Room, pear aroma, very pale golden, no head, sweet pear with an apple tartness, soft carbonation, very easy to drink
Draught at the Ealing JDW, pale yellow with a fruity pear nose, dry-sweet and lightly fruity, Sweetish finish.
Poured bright light golden with a small head. Aroma of sweet, tart pears. Light body, flavour as the aroma. Refreshing.
white partially cloudy color. Mildly tannic, a touch sweet and light body. Very quaffable. Lots of pear character. Extremely refreshing. Excellent

Polycask at Banbury Beer Festival, Thursday 8th May 2014   Pours looking like Robinsons Lemon flavoured Barley Water. A little pear drops on the nose. This like its Barbourne colleagues is a juicy perry. Clearly the most distinctive of the Barboune trio but also one that some might not get on with.  A6 A4 T8 P4 Ov14 3.6
